newsitem.title: CHINA: China Shanghai money market sees '96 record trade.
newsitem.headline: China Shanghai money market sees '96 record trade.

text.p: Total trading on the Shanghai national interbank money market hit a record high of 178.4 billion yuan in 1996, accounting for about 30.38 percent of the nation's total, the Xinhua news agency said on Friday.
Borrowing and lending almost broke even last year, standing at 87.77 billion and 88 billion yuan, respectively, it said quoting a report in the Shanghai Securities News.

"A unification of the money market last year was the major element behind the huge volume of transaction, as it channelled more funds from outside Shanghai into the municipality," said an official at the city's interbank market.
The Shanghai-based national money market was currently electronically hooked up to 20 banks and 35 regional money centres, Xinhua said.
The centre reduced interest rates in the face of oversupply of capital, seven times in April alone, bringing the average rate down to 11.354 from 12.713 early last year, it said.
It also developed an intermediary market role for interbank lending and borrowing from last August, accumulating 2.64 billion yuan in such trading, Xinhua said but gave no more details.
